intro: Pentacalia veleziae, commonly known as the Vélez's pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and is found in arid or semi-arid regions. It has small, narrow leaves and produces violet or blue flowers that bloom in the summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
